Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to visit again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_Mrs_K_TN
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start oogling about how great Auberge is! Upon arrival, you are greeted with a glass of wine. The rooms are beautiful, each having a private balcony with a beautiful view of the valley below. The mini bar is stocked with great snack items and beverages. When we arrived in our room, there was a cute little birthday cake and bottle of bubbly for my husband's birthday. This place is all about the details (we even received a thank you card via mail at home!). The staff is great, always looking for the extra thing to make your day. There is a complimentary Mercedes rental program for guests as well. We stayed during the off season while they were renovating, but we barely even noticed the work -- even with them getting a new roof! We sadly left and headed to the next relais, but Auberge was the best of our week in Napa. The location is close to all the great food and wine locations but far enough away to make it seem like paradise where you are the only person in the world who matters. The rooms are full of natural light, and the beds are feather alternative and provide for the best sleep ever. The bathroom is divided, so the toilet is in a side area with its own door. The view from the bar cannot be beat at sunset, and they even have heaters on the ceiling as needed. If you have the chance to stay at Auberge and don't, you will truly miss out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicole B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011, and this hotel was amazing. We loved every minute of our stay. Our room was beautiful and spacious, the pool service was top notch with excellent food, we loved our meals at the restaurant on the deck at sunset with the beautiful view.. we have not one complaint about our entire trip. We just had a fabulous weekend together and we feel this hotel was nicer than many of the fancy hotels we've stayed at previously. My husband and I often find ourselves daydreaming about our next trip to Auberge du Soleil, and we've decided to make it an annual anniversary trip for us.

Reviews.Title: “Auberge exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: pepper99
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the auberge with pretty high expectations based on the many things that we had read and heard about it. Sometimes it is hard for a place to live up to it's hype but that wasn't the case here. We loved every minute of being here. We also were fortunate to be here at the beginning of December so we got to see the thanksgiving and Christmas decorations. The staff was great, the room was incredible, the spa was gorgeous and the food was delicious. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Proved my husband a hero”
Reviews.Author: SLVPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: This restaurant came highly recommended by experienced wine county friends - told my husband "you'll be a hero". They were completely correct. This was at the high end of what we had wanted to spend and was the "big dinner" of our all too short trip to the area. Although we found the ordering a tiny bit confusing, the food was fabulous. Not one thing we didn't love. The wine selections were excellent and reasonable (for the type of restaurant). Service was good and the restaurant lovely. We visited in March and so could not enjoy the gardens that are reported to be lovely. I was happy to see that the servers were well versed in how the food was prepared and open to questions form curious guests. While I would not recommend this for families with children, it is only that it might diminish the romantic mood of the restaurant. A family seated narby had 2 children with them (amybe 5 -7 years) and they were catered to in a lovely manner. This would be a "must do" on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: TexasTwin
Reviews.Content: This property was on my "bucket" list of hotels since the mid-80s when I used to visit the wine country twice a month from my home in Silicon Valley. I couldn't affort it back then, so we decided to try it for a Valentine's Day getaway. We have been fortunate to stay in several nice hotels recently(like The Peninsula in Beverly Hills and The Carlyle in NYC) so I was interested to stay at Auberge to compare because Auberge is, by far, much more expensive. I had the same experience as a previous reviewer, in that the rate I was quoted on the phone was $100 more than the rate I found on the Internet, which was frustrating and unnecessary in my view. I also used the Concierge prior to my stay to book winery tours. She was very helpful and friendly and her follow-through was excellent. She also booked a couple of local restaurants, which was great but we did not have a car and had no idea it would be impossible to get a cab back to Auberge from St. Helena. One of the couples dining at the restaurant was kind enough to give us lift - make sure you have a car. We booked the cheapest room and got an upgrade at check-in. We had a terrace but could not see the Valley yet we liked the privacy. The complimentary snacks and bottle of wine in the room was a very nice touch, as was the nightly turn-down. The staff throughout the property was very friendly. The grounds are lovely; loved the sculptures and landscaping. We ate 2 dinners at the Bistro, which is more casual than the formal dining room but we much preferred it. We had reservations at the formal restaurant for Valentine's night, but sat down and saw it was a fixed-price, four course meal and we had had so much wine that we again opted for a cheese/pate platter & oysters in the Bistro. The staff at the restaurant did not make us feel at all uncomfortable about opting for the Bistro. We had very noisy neighbors two of the three nights during our stay. I mentioned it to the front desk manager our final morning and she followed up with me after we checked out and gave us a discount on our bill. I really appreciated her taking the time and effort to address the issue even after we departed. That is an indication that Auberge cares about their guests enough to want them to return, even in a touristy area like Napa Valley. We will return, but I do feel the nightly price of this hotel is too high given the property.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible taste to the end of our trip”
Reviews.Author: Eileen L
Reviews.Content: The above heading can't summarise my first visit to a.d.s enough. Having spent an amazing stay for our anniversary and my birthday in napa with the poetry inn ( which by the way the staff at auberge bistro can clearly learn sth fr in terms of service), my partner and I decided to check out auberge in view if the supposedly excellent ratings on tripadvisor as we were planning to return to napa pretty soon. To be fair we were pleasantly greeted by the staff at the front desk and lady in front of the bistro who helpfully gave suggestions. There was also a gentleman (?manager - he was in a smart blue shirt and suit) who helpfully suggested an all day bistro menu. With a gd start, we decided to have a bite at the bistro while waiting for dinner. I distinctly rem it was 4pm on 12th feb 2012. But it was downhill -fast- once we stepped in. 1) there were 3 waiters and 1 waitress at tht time. The place was not full, but no one bothered to show us to seats. Granted, it is likely perhaps a free seating bistro, so we made our way outdoors to find a tAble. HOWEVER, just a couple of minutes later, one of the waiters led a grp of ladies to their tables outdoors, while pleasantly explaining to them the amazing views their seats will have. This irks me very much and makes me wonder abt the substandard treatment. 2) my partner truly wanted us to enjoy the lovely view, considering we flew a long distance to napa and it being our first visit here. He thus went over and spoke to the (only) female waitress who mentioned we could shift over to the seats once she was done clearing the table up. We thus waited at another table . What happened next was a positive shock. The waiter whom I mentioned above led 3 ladies to the table and promptly sat them down. Granted, the team.s communication might not have been excellent and thus, he was not made aware of us wanting the tAble. However, what made me boil was h ow the lady waitress blatantly saw the three ladies sit, and didn't even flinch a bit. I waited a while to see if she will come over and at least explain or offer another seat, but no.. With such disregard, we decided not to eat at such a place. Before I left, I sought an explanation for what happened from her. And her totally not giving me any eye contact and flippantly saying "oh yea it's free seating you knw, hang on" while looking at the cashier was the last straw for me. is this how a supposedly renowned hotel staff treats a customer? How did the ratings get this high?? To be honest, the view is not to die for, I enjoyed better views and service from the poetry inn, it's just such a let down that such service can exist in a supposedly 5star facility housing a Michelin starred restaurant. Obviously, the service of the staff at the Bistro is not on par with that star... A true disappointment, and I'll put my money somewhere more deserving the next flight up.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQinHou
Reviews.Content: This resort has it all. You can stay in the hotel section and enjoy the shared pool (which is till wonderful) or you can choose a private suite/villa (which we did). We had a private garden suite, with a separate living room with fireplace, dining table, half bath, full kitchen with full size Jenn Aire Fridge stocked with wine, cheese, and fruit, and french doors to our patio/pool area. The master bedroom also had a fireplace and a king bed, fabulous bath suite, and french doors to the patio/pool area. We couldn't have enjoyed it more! We relaxed by the pool each morning with coffee (or mimosas) while reading the paper, and enjoyed a relaxing dip in the pool each evening upon our return. The food at the restaurant (and room service) is excellent. Beautifully prepared and presented, and just the right amount. Everything is first class (and pricey) but it is worth every penny. This must be what heaven is like!

Reviews.Title: “Lunch”
Reviews.Author: travelgogo
Reviews.Content: Great service-window seat to look over the valley- great food-small portions,but just right-

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Merlotlondon74
Reviews.Content: I first visited Auberge du Soleil 10 years ago, when I dropped in for lunch whilst in Napa on a business trip. I'd been struck by the beauty of the spot then - where better than enjoy the Napa Valley than this? And so I resolved to come here with my partner, as a special celebration for our 5th anniversary. Everything about this place is first-class. The rooms are impeccably maintained, comfortable and have fantastic views. The breakfasts are wonderful (you can have whatever you choose from the a la carte menu) and the lunch is a very solid Michelin-starred standard. You can spend your days relaxing in the warm and hot tubs in the spa (we couldn't face the cold one, having dipped a toe in it!), enjoying the view and the quiet, or borrow a top-of-the-range Mercedes and zoom around the Napa in it - as we did - it's up to you! It's the staff, however, that really sets this place apart. Professional, helpful and just lovely (Lisa in the spa took a photo of us on her IPhone on our anniversary, and emailed it to us later that day with a lovely message - this really made our stay), they make you feel thoroughly spoilt. We'd started plotting our return here before we'd left... always a sign of a hit! Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.”
Reviews.Author: Ch0mpers
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel experience I've had thus far. We visited in September for 3 nights. The breakfast each morning was amazing, the pool area is heavenly, and the rooms were casually chic. I've never paid this much per night (and wondered if I could justify it), but after having stayed here, it was worth it, and we will be back. And we will stay a few more nights the next time. Take advantage of the concierge; the hotel booked us on some amazing winery tours that we otherwise would not have identified on our own. The spa is not to be missed; really well done and worth the cost. The people who work at this resort are all so kind and down-to-earth and really contributed to making our stay so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, amazing views, good service”
Reviews.Author: jgnhols
Reviews.Content: Luxurious, spacious, clean, beautiful surroundings (the room had an unblocked view towards the vineyards), nice spread of breakfast, and helpful service staff. Definitely live up to the 5-star luxury standard.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly stay”
Reviews.Author: GothamAdventurer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Lorraine 3, an Upper Valley View Suite, for 2 nights in November. Like a prior reviewer, we spent the night at the Ritz Carlton San Francisco prior. There is really no use comparing the 2 properties - they are completely different experiences. Here's a summary: - easy drive from San Francisco, took 90 minutes both ways. Take the Silverado Trail, not Route 29, it is much more picturesque. This part of Napa is not built up in the least, all you can see for miles around are rolling vineyards, picturesque villas, and majestic mountains. - another tip, the grape leaves actually turn colors in the fall just like regular trees do. it was to see rows and rows of bright yellow, orange and dark red leaves. - upon check-in you will be offered a glass of the Auberge house cabernet - it is wonderful. You'll also get a free bottle of this red, plus a white and the champagne, in your mini bar. They are fantastic. - I really recommend the Upper Valley View suite. some of the units look down over the parking area or onto other rooms (all the rooms are housed in stand-alone cottages that generally have 2 floors, with 2 rooms per floor). our view was sweeping and majestic, over the vineyards and mountain ranges beyond. our terrace was so private we could not be seen from any of the other rooms. - at first the decor of the suite struck me as dated and somewhat 70s. lots of earth tones and wooden built-ins. however, it actually grew on me over time. also, the rooms are scheduled to be updated in the near future, one of them has already been completed. - the main restaurant was fantastic - service incredibly attentive and the food was fantastic. wine list is very extensive. - the service we encountered at every turn was fantastic. for example although it was not prime season for the pool and we were the only couple there, the attendant was extremely gracious. any time we requested something be brought to the suite it appeared within 5 minutes. - the concierge arranged for two private wine tastings for us at nearby vineyards - do this! it is like going to someone's home - they are one-on-one tastings and we were invited into the vineyards to eat grapes right off the vine and were also given a tour of the production area and caves. - one more tip - we took a fantastic hike at the Oat Hill Mine trailhead in Calistoga. it is about a 10-minute drive up the Silverado Trail just over the Calistoga town line. It has some excellent vertical climb and the entire hike has fantastic views of the valley. You'll meet some very friendly people along the trail as well. - there's a nice spa area with lots of free food to nibble on, nuts, dried fruit, excellent baked bread, different types of tea, and even champagne! services were great and they have 3 different hot tubs outside set to different temperatures. - also housekeeping was fantastic. the suite was very large and every single inch of it was spotless. All in all one of the best stays we've ever had and we can't wait to return next fall.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the astronomical price!”
Reviews.Author: str82th
Reviews.Content: After spending two nights at the Ritz-Carlton San Francisco in a suite (about $1000/night) we had a pretty easy comparison of what a $1500/night suite should look like and how service should compare. The Ritz in San Fran was amazing and one of the best Ritz's we have ever seen. The upgraded room was well worth it. Although not a complete disaster, the Auberge du Soleil was a real disappointment in several ways and definitely nowhere worth the price. Yes, the service was good but far from exceptional. Yes, the suite was nice but not even close to our rooms at other hotels that were 1/2 the price. The furniture was cheap, most of the surfaces on the counter-tops were fake marble (wow) and the shower and bathroom hardware and fixtures are available at the Lowe's around the corner. The "kitchen" featured no ice maker, a few bottles of soft drinks, beer and wine (that are so overpriced its a joke) and a microwave oven (probably cost the hotel about $75) too small to fit the bag of popcorn offered as one of the very few snacks. Also, the shower's water pressure was ridiculously low. Finally, instead of a real bar of soap they had pump canisters of shower gel, lotion and shampoo with really cheap contents. The floors were all poorly installed wood and not even nice wood. The pool was small and only salt-water so not great for swimming laps. The restaurant in the hotel was nice because of the view overlooking the valley below. The prices were absolutely a gouge-fest. There were no options on the menu that were less than $100/person as it was all fixed price menus. Our bill for a pretty simple dinner was $330 for two people with one glass of wine each. The service was slow and we had to ask for coffee after dinner three times. Finally we just left since nobody seemed to remember. In the morning we had breakfast at the same restaurant because it was the only thing available and the breakfast although again overpriced was part of our room package so why not? Again, no coffee for a long time. The tables on the patio where setup so that they were directly into the sunlight so you couldn't see the person at your table you wanted to talk with and the umbrellas couldn't be moved to block the sun. Service was very slow but the food was very good (kudos there). I know Auberge has received great marks from others but I don't get it. Again, I am comparing it to a Ritz but the Ritz was practically half the price and in a very big and expensive city. My recommendation--if you want to tour wine country just stay in the city (San Fran) and drive up the 60 minutes or take the train and relax. Enjoy the other $500-1000 a night by splurging on something else on your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: GregandRobin
Reviews.Content: The rooms are perfect without pretension, as is the restaurant. The service is excellent, and the views are the best in the valley.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Cost”
Reviews.Author: R W
Reviews.Content: While the property is showing its signs of age and the spacious rooms (which are, in effect bungalows) reveal a little bit of dust in some corners, the overall experience of the property is outstanding. We enjoyed the ability to come and go as we pleased from our bunglow-type room from which our car was a short walk away. We liked the experience of directly entering our room from the outside rather than needing to constantly walk through a lobby. The views from the site on which the rooms and main building are nestled are among the best in the Valley. I also liked the idea of an all-inclusive daily rate which includes unlimited use of the minibar.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: Landmarkfinder A
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended we stay here for our first stay in the Napa. We were overwhelmed by the hospitality as well as the convenience of this place. It was hard to imagine we were not in Tuscany. We are probably a little jaded about vineyards and so were not interested in doing tastings so much as relaxing for a couple days. The Auberge could not have been more perfect. Our room was one of the least expensive but nevertheless was enormous with a huge terrace, a beautiful view of the valley, and every amenity. The pool is very comfortable and we found dining next to it easier than moving anywhere else. At night we let our car in the lot and borrowed one of the Mercedes Benz models that are on loan to guests, driving down to Yountville and Boucheron. The next day we borrowed another model and drove through the fields. The desk sent us on a wonderful hike into the hills above one vineyard. Two days here felt like a month and we look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Just beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: OllieDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aburge for our 10th anniversary and canâ€™t say enough good things about it. We splurged a little on our room but it was totally worth it â€“ views are amazing. The room was very well equipped and beautifully decorated. We also received a little pastry for our anniversary and it was a nice touch and super delicious. Restaurant was fantastic â€“ best dinner we had in Napa. We also enjoyed our morning breakfasts every morning on the patio overlooking the valley and it was breathtaking. Customer service was fantastic and we had a very nice and relaxing long weekend. This has become one of our favorite hotels and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Par Exellence”
Reviews.Author: InTheBizMyself
Reviews.Content: From the minute I arrived til the very sad goodbye, I thoroughly enjoyed every moment, morsel and staff member! By recognizing me as I arrived (2nd visit) to sumptuous breakfasts and libations by the pool, to a 7 star 90 minute massage, to the Mercedes E550 Convertible that was mine everyday for 4 hours...I felt like a king! My suite was appointed with every amenty, comfortable and quietly beautiful. Thank you Auberge for getting it right!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views with lackluster service”
Reviews.Author: wroth
Reviews.Content: Perced on a mountain overlooking the vineyards..the location is beautiful. Service however is lacking. Unpolished and unwilling to be of much help( concierge wise) and despite paying $45 per glass of champagne by the pool X 2....I couldnt get a tray to put it on..despite 2 requests! Also a loud group of 30+people gathered by the pool, with music blaring, was not my idea of a quiet restful getaway...which is what is promoted in explaining their "no children under 16" policy. Hmmm..All this for nearly 2K per night?? Not again. Kuddos though to the chef and wait staff for excellent meals!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Property”
Reviews.Author: KAMiami
Reviews.Content: This property gets it right with magnificent atmosphere and terrific service. A true luxury experience from check-in to departure. It would be hard to find room for improvement. We have stayed in many luxury properties where the price does not always equal quality...not the case here, Auberge goes beyond and you will leave feeling you got your money's worth and more.

Reviews.Title: “TRULY A FIRST CLASS LUXURY EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: H1
Reviews.Content: After going back and forth in my mind trying to decided where to stay for my first Napa vacation, I decided to treat my spouse and I to a stay at the Auberge. The price is much higher than most accomdations in the Napa valley but the Auberge was worth every penny. The room is spacious and luxurious and makes you feel like you are in a luxurious home vs. a resort room. What a great touch that all snacks and mini bar items can be consumed at no extra cost. We were treated like royalty during our entire stay. Had dinner in the restaurant and would definately recommend the tasting menu to anyone - breakfast was also excellent and included in our nightly rate. I made use of the fitness center and spa and both were great. The massage treatment was excellent but soaking in the 3 pools in the spa area was like my own private oasis - I could have stayed there all day. The fitness center was clean and had very top notch modern equipment plus a beautiful balcony with free weights, fitness balls, spin bike, etc.. This place is definately worth the extra money - I can't wait to get back there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for week of spa in wine country!”
Reviews.Author: artkatztrip
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Auberge du Soleil and it was a real treasure. We were pampered from the moment we stepped onto the property and took full advantage of the spa treatments offered in their deluxe spa. Completely rejuvenated by the end of our week in paradise. Five stars!

Reviews.Title: “Nobody does it better!!”
Reviews.Author: JLands
Reviews.Content: It was my 3rd stay at the hotel and it just keep getting better and better! The staff is the epitomy of perfection, always a smile and warm greeting and eager to do whatever it takes to make the stay memorable. They are truly the best! The breakfast and lunches are fantastic with amazing views. These people just really get it. The rooms are clean and updated and the bed is awesome too. The pool area perfect and the gym is more than adequate. They cannot do enough for you here. I visit Napa every other year and I would never stay anywhere else! PS- They also have Mercedes courtesy cars available for use

Reviews.Title: “French Getaway”
Reviews.Author: clyons24542001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Auberge Du Soleil as a "base" for several winery tours. This is the perfect location to explore the area. Rent a car and live like a local. The hotel is setup as many detached units each overlooking a breathtaking view of the fields and valley's. I truly had flashbacks to many stays in rural France. Feels like you are in Bordeaux or Normandie countryside. The service at the hotel is fantastic. Had several requests to be made-ready prior to our arrival. All requests were taken care of and no delays. Many local restaurants with celebrity chef's everywhere. Obviously, the best wine selection and availability in the US. Don't miss an opportunity to dine at French Laundry. BOOK WELL IN ADVANCE!!! Great Property. Very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning! Wish we could have stayed for longer”
Reviews.Author: Stones7
Reviews.Content: We got married at Auberge, and so spent the first night of our married lives at the hotel. We have been lucky enough to stay at high-end properties before, but Auberge is now amongst our favourites because it's refined and classy, but still manages to be relaxed and homely. It didn't feel like a hotel in many ways, almost as though we were staying in our own wine country apartment. Of course the bed was huge, and comfortable; and the huge room offered all the amenities you could ever think of. The resort was also extremely peaceful and quiet, and we took a lovely walk through the grounds admiring some of the art installations they have on-site. The staff were great. Very helpful, and when we returned to our room after the wedding celebrations they'd laid a path of petals to the door, and left a bottle of champagne on ice and a cake for us in the room. Which was a lovely touch. The breakfast was also incredible, but perhaps our favourite memory was much more simple, it was walking out onto our balcony first thing in the morning, and having a coffee whilst still in our robes overlooking the Napa Valley below us. Of course a property of this standard doesn't come cheap, and you're paying for the exclusivity and luxury it offers. We only got to stay one night as we were off on our honeymoon the following day, and so didn't get a chance to try the spa, pool or gym; or any of the other facilities on offer which kind of felt like a shame, but we would go back without a second thought. We just need some time to save for it first.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL RESORT WITH LOVELY GROUNDS”
Reviews.Author: GalvestonJT
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this beautiful resort. There was an issue or two which I will discuss later. Overall - great! First,the grounds are lovely. My best description: perfectly landscaped sculpture gardens. Flowers and more flowers. Fountains. Overlooks. Benches. Herb gardens. Second, the entire resort is cut from the hillside. Rooms are hidden in the landscape. Much privacy. Outdoor patios are secluded. Third, I really like the folks at the resort. We initially drove into the resort and were greeted by a pleasant young bellman and a check-in lady. Smiles galore. We followed our bellman's golf cart down the hill to our room. He checked us into our room and took us on a tour of the property. The spa coordinator was helpful with a minor favor. Nice folks! Fourth, the breakfast - offered in the main dining room and part of the room price - was excellent. Order from the menu. The best Eggs Benedict I have ever eaten. Finally, the evening meal has our family divided. I loved the fresh ingredients and the presentations. My wife - the food expert - was less impressed. She was unimpressed with the wine by the glass choices, the food tastes and so on. Not horrible, just not up to the highest standard. Our evening meal was about $250 for two. On one thing, we do agree - a little too expensive. To the negatives: I killed two large daddy long leg spiders in the room and found a third spider of a different species under the vanity. Please folks, use a little unscented bug spray and check the rooms for critters - daily. At $1000 or more per night, the guest deserve this. Also, the room was a bit noisy. My wife heard banging from the room above. I heard this awful loud generator during the day. Serenity killers. Please note that not every room has a panoramic valley view. We had a view of the the sky, parking lot and another building. I suspect that - the more you pay, the better the view? This is one special place, make no mistake. I can recommend it to anyone. I received an email from the hotel within 6 hours of check out - asking for my feedback. I provided the feedback you see above and have yet to hear back from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple laid back luxury!”
Reviews.Author: jmainelli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July of 2007 for one night. We were upgraded from a basic garden room to a 1 bedroom suite with amazing views! We had dinner reservations but when we saw our beautiful suite we decided to cancel them! We spent the entire evening into the night out on our huge terrace! The mini bar is all complimentary and we took full advantage! In addition we would highly recommend the restaurant - even if you do not stay here. Go for lunch and sit out on the deck to take in the amazing views! And finally the pool is so relaxing and serene and comfortable it's a dream. And we got excellent massages at the spa and spent lots of time enjoying the amazing plunge pools with gorgeous views once we were done! Just an awesome place. So worth it! Also centrally located but within walking distance to nothing.

Reviews.Title: “A truly beautiful place with some glaring insufficiencies.”
Reviews.Author: mafitch
Reviews.Content: I booked an Upper Valley view for 1100 dollars per night plus taxes. Check-in was a confusing process. There is simply a big parking lot where we received no direction as to where we should go or what to do. It was only after parking and walking in to the lobby that we learned that after checking in, you follow a staff member in your car through some gates and to your room where they carry your bags inside. We didn't receive any information about the room really. The staff member kind of dropped our bags and left. I will say, there wasn't much to tell. Everything is pretty straightforward. LCD TV, big shower, fireplace, small kitchenette stocked with light snacks, drinks and coffee all free of charge. Wi-Fi is free as well. The property is really beautiful and the restaurant was far and away the best meal we had over our 3 nights in the valley. The location is great. Rutherford is right in the middle of everything so St. Helena, Yountville, Oakville are all very accessible. Napa and Calistoga are the furthest drives but still not bad. Now for my gripes: I got newspapers on the 1st and 3rd mornings but not the 2nd, turn-down service comes early, typically when you are getting ready for dinner. The sound isolation between the rooms is VERY poor. Lots of banging around and general noise from adjoining rooms, the sprinkler system (sounds like a faucet is on in the bathroom) and golf carts, ladders and general maintenance out on the property in the mornings before 9am. It's a bit of a contradiction really. You have this very private and almost isolated resort nestled up above the road where you can sit out on your terrace at night and hear wild turkeys in the distance but within the resort it is just noisy. My final complaint: It's 2011 and with all the information collected on the guests before, during and after their stay, it should not be much of a mystery that there were 2 men staying in our room, not a man and a woman. It was annoying to come back to the room every night to ladies' slippers and robe on one side of the bed and mens on the other. In my opinion it speaks to a lack of personal care and attention which is unacceptable for a resort with so few rooms. In summary, the property is beautiful, but the restaurant aside I found the service to be average and even lacking in some regard. Before booking the trip, we had a debate over whether to do a week split between the Ritz-Carlton SF and Auberge or go back to O&O Palmilla for a week. You see which we picked in the end, but frankly after staying at this very highly rated/regarded and expensive resort, there is just NO comparison. We're already booking our return trip to Palmilla for the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect retreat”
Reviews.Author: mrben10
Reviews.Content: So very impressed with ADS. Relais et chateaux should be thankful to have this property as a member (I find them a bit hit and miss overall), is definately one of the best. Arrived here after four days in San Francisco and instantly relaxed. Beautiful hotel, amazing views, outstanding raised terrace for breakfast/lunch/dinner. Pool beautiful (best lilo's in pool I have ever sampled - feel cheated now when going anywhere else). Esperanza breakfast I can still taste. Foie Gras exceptional (in the U.S? - remarkable). Spa - beautiful. Everything about this place is beautiful. Gripes - cannot remember any, perhaps I would have exploded if we had stayed longer due to the richness of the menu, but that is a nice gripe to have. A treat.

Reviews.Title: “I can't imagine a nicer place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: RoscoeNyc
Reviews.Content: Service is amazing. Facilities are gorgeous. Pretty darn romantic and sexy. Only negatives: outdoor spa hot tubs are closed too early.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate romantic escape”
Reviews.Author: SuzyChapstick30
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times and each time it has gotten better. I find it hard to believe that there are any reviews less than excellent. The service has always been the best I have experienced at any hotel. They have set up private wine tastings for us and always give us the same room. The food is amazing and honestly breakfast and room service are extremely affordable given the level hotel. I love that you don't get nickeled and dimed like at other hotels. You pay more but you get so much more that you are able to truly relax and enjoy your stay. It remains my top choice for special occasion get aways.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views and service”
Reviews.Author: pkrehbiel
Reviews.Content: A fantastic property with a staff focused on delivering superlative service. From room service, to spa massages, al fresco dinner on the deck, and their world famous and world class wine cellar, there was not one moment that disappointed. The concierge desk arranged a wonderful driver for us and we had a magical few days experiencing the vineyards, tastes, and hospitality of both Napa and the Auberge du Soleil. We wanted to go back as soon as we got home, Pete

Reviews.Title: “Also cheated”
Reviews.Author: lujotravel
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for 6 nights and within 24 hours (barely after the confirmation hit my email in box) I had a family emergency I had to attend to and my secretary called to cancel the reservation. I obviously did not show up. Later I get a phone call stating that since I did not show up they were going to charge me over $12,000.00 for NOTHING, they say they were never contacted. I contacted American Express to dispute the charge and Auberge refused to compensate me for anything. I have contacted them again and asked for a reasonable response and I am waiting to hear back. I am expecting a class act response from a class act hotel but the jury is out. I will report back to the post with their comments. If that is the case I would not accept their cancelation policy or at least modify it so that you are protected as a consumer against this exorbitant penalty for their lack of ignoring the call my secretary made. Since the amount is so high, it may be worth a lawsuit in small claims court but I will hold on to my options until I see what they come up with.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Romantic Weekend Ever”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAngeleno
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise Valentine's Day trip from my sweetheart. Every aspect of our stay was incredibly romantic. We stayed in the Loire Maison which included every luxury amenity you could ever need, a fully stocked, complimentary wet bar, gym, outdoor spa and a fantastic view of the valley. The concierge did a wonderful job booking unique, impressive, private wine tours and activities (highly recommend the private cooking class). We are foodies and being in Napa, we were able to indulge in all the best restaurants both high and mid-range in price with the concierge's recommendations. Not one detail was overlooked by the staff; they really went out of the way to provide a wonderful Valentine's Day experience for the both of us. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered to the max!”
Reviews.Author: beachlvrca62
Reviews.Content: My friends and I planned a girls getaway for a long weekend and we booked a package at Auberge which we could not have asked for a more wonderful stay! It was perfectly relaxing and especially loved the spa treatments!!! If I was a millionaire, I would love to live here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: 3sacharm
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Auberge and had the most wonderful time. It was an experience I have a hard time putting into words. The spa treatments were outstanding, the food delicious, the staff so friendly and helpful and the grounds made me feel like I was in another world. I'm so glad to have this in our backyard. I can't wait to go back. This is truly a exquisite property and the amenities were thoughtful, elegant and relaxed. I LOVED it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly perfect”
Reviews.Author: GoldsGuide
Reviews.Content: I am always a little nervous of supposed great boutique hotels that have been around for a long time. They tend to be a let down and always edging towards the wrong side of needing improvements. This was not the case here. Auberge is a masterpiece on every possible front. Great rooms with great views. Beautiful pool. Fabulous staff and indescribable food. It truly gets no better. Spend the money and enjoy the very best. To show you how much they care, I spilled red wine down a monstrously expensive sweater. The outstanding concierge ladies took my sweater themselves and worked all afternoon to give it back to me like new. It was not their job description but that's typical of this hotel. It just makes memories.

Reviews.Title: “WOW -- what a place”
Reviews.Author: EH10014
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this place was magnificent. The hotel cascades down the hill with the reception and the restaurant at the top and bungalows nestled in gardens filled with whimsical sculptures of flowers and animals and tasteful water features. The pool area is gorgeous (reminded us of the Four Seasons in Hawaii). The room was large and the bathroom was even bigger (double sinks, large two person shower and two person tub). We had two double doors leading to a patio overlooking the gardens. Every amenity you could think of was available. A delicious full service breakfast in the restaurant, either inside or on the terrace, was included in the room rate. This place is a splurge but worth every penny IMHO (our room was next to the cheapest so I canâ€™t imagine what the upper end rooms must be like).

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled Forever”
Reviews.Author: GrabYourHat
Reviews.Content: Definitely a special occasion destination! Beautiful grounds, gardens and outdoor sculptures that are available to guests only or by prior arrangement making it very private, quiet and serene. Fabulous pool area overlooking the Napa Valley. The restaurant was fabulous for dinner. We ate on the balcony and when there was a chill in the air, they graciously brought me a pashmina. Breakfast was fabulous and was included in the room cost as were all the goodies in the room. I would call it a once in a lifetime experience but I'm hoping it's not!

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS AWESOME! My new favorite...”
Reviews.Author: Jibby1
Reviews.Content: THIS PLACE IS AWESOME! My new favorite hotel in the world. First class everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, poor front desk attitude”
Reviews.Author: ajmia111
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Auberge du Soleil was a mixed bag. The resort itself is beautiful. Our accommodations, while expensive (an upper valley room suite), were essentially perfect - great size, awesome views, excellent amenities, good housekeeping services, etc. Where Auberge failed, and it did so in a major way, was in the poor attitude of its front desk personnel. We were checked in by two miserably unhappy and unwelcoming young women who appeared disengaged, annoyed and were essentially hostile. Its hard to describe their attitude - but its an attitude that Auberge's management should work hard to correct. None says hello, none smiles, none offers a greeting or even makes casual eye contact - its as if they've perfected the art of disdain. As an example, when we asked, politely, where we might change our clothes, store our bags, perhaps use the spa or swimming pool, have lunch, etc., until our room was ready (which we were advised would be in 3-4 hours) we were told to "read your welcoming materials". Rules are conveyed as commands - along the lines of "your breakfasts are included, you may not order room service as your included breakfast, you may not have your included breakfast in any venue other than the main restaurant" - all of this without us having asked any questions about whether breakfast was included or where we might eat it. When in another unpleasant encounter with the front desk we offered (again politely) to leave and book a room elsewhere, we were told that we were welcome to stay or that they would be happy to "secure us alternative accommodations". Every encounter with the front desk (fortunately, after check-in there is little need to deal with them) was one of hostility not hospitality. This changed only at check-out, when we were offered apologies by the front desk manager (who presumably was told of the exchanges by a very nice gentleman who greets guests on their arrival) - an apology we felt was two days (and thousands of dollars) too late in coming.

Reviews.Title: “EXPENSIVE BUT WORTH THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: JORDSYDMIA
Reviews.Content: Anyone who thinks this palce has an attitiude must have gone there with the wrong attitude themselves. Having traveled the world for 40 years staying at 5 star hotels, this was probably the nicest place we ever stayed.From the moment we checked in to the moment we left, the staff could not have been more accomodating and friendly. The room,grounds, pool area, spa and restaurant could not have been lovelier. GO, relax and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect ending to 15 yr. anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: 5trans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate our 15 yr wedding anniversary in style and agreed it would have to be the northern California coast. We started our stay at the Post Ranch Inn, then up to The Inn at Spanish Bay, and finally ended up at Auberge du Soleil. The other 2 places were nice (Post Ranch more exclusive than Spanish Bay) but by far my favorite was Auberge. We spent about 2 nights in each location and my best sleep was the final 2 nights--not because we were getting used to the schedule but the beds were incredibly comfortable! It's amazing about all the freebies you get in the room that I don't think I've experienced anywhere else (Post Ranch also has the same arrangement.) The mini-bar and fridge were completely stocked and complimentary and replenished daily. While there, you must walk around the grounds and take a look at their sculpture garden--what a treat, and you don't really have to be art lovers to appreciate the surroundings. Usually at a place like this, you will expect to pay >1,000/night (we had the upper valley view), but hopefully you will know that at the time of booking so you won't complain about the price and say how "expensive" it is. Having said that, you get so much more than a comparable hotel that throws in nothing more than free bottled water. The exception would be the Four Seasons hotels. We usually stay at a Four Seasons when we travel with our children and their amenities/service is top-notch but like I mentioned before, they have never had a complimentary mini-bar. If you get a chance, splurge on dinner at The French Laundry, which the Auberge was more than happy to reserve a table for us. If you are a foodie like my husband and I are, you will appreciate the meal. We still talk about it and can close our eyes and picture the dish then remember the taste. You'll never forget the meal...the restaurant itself is not that fancy or impressive though. Service however, rivaled the food. Napa Valley is a romantic setting to celebrate something special and Auberge du Soleil gets top honors from me as the perfect place to accomplish that as well.

Reviews.Title: “This is Heaven”
Reviews.Author: lovegoodhotels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here to celebrate our anniversary. When we arrived at the Auberge, the valet immediately took our car and lead us into the lobby, where a very nice woman checked us in. They handed us two glasses of chardonnay while we paroused the map of the resort. A nice way to begin our vacation. Once we escorted to our lovely upper valley king room, we were awestruck by the incredible view. We were also amazed by all of the complimentary amenities! The fridge was stocked with our favorite beverages, including a bottle of the house champagne, (very good), and on top there was an espresso maker and a lot of different snack foods. In the bathroom cabinet is every toiletry you could possibly need, in case you forgot anything. There are candles on the huge bathtub and on the fireplace in the bedroom. Very romantic. The beds were soft on top but didn't jiggle when your partner moved, so sleeping was quite comfortable. The only thing interrupting our sleep was the very thin walls. You could hear everything outside your door and through the wall next door. However, people usually tried to keep it down, apparently being aware of that fact. If you have a problem with the noise, especially with the maids outside or next door, just place a quick call to the front desk and they somehow take care of it. Our spa day was like a day in heaven! Three different temperature spring pools with spectacular views, complimentary champagne, snacks and tea were some of the highlights. The masseuses were very focused on your personal needs. The relaxation room was private and very quiet. Housekeeping was a dream team. They always came immediately when you would call for service and they always did a wonderful job, never forgetting to replenish any amenity. Turndown service was also very good, always making certain that everything was refreshed. The room and the patio were very clean. Service at the pool was unbelieveably good! The poolside server made you feel as though you had your own butler. They were attentive, without being intrusive, and master drink makers! You tell them what you want and that's exactly what you get. There was no stinginess with the alcohol in the mixed drinks. The poolside chairs were huge and wonderfully comforable. 'Floaties' in the pool were also complimentary. Lunch was always good and served promptly. The only glitch we had was when three "C" list celebrities took over the pool one day with very inappropriate behavior. If only I could print what they did but I shouldn't! Finally, management came in and stopped it. We were impressed by the hotel's actions. No intimidation by poorly behaving celebrities here! The restaurant was a delight, by the way. Every morning, they offer a complimentary breakfast. You can order as much as you like from the menu. Everything was fresh and delicious. On the night of our anniversary, my husband and I had the prix fixe menu with the wine pairing. We had a table outside facing the best view on the property. The food and service were very good, as was naturally, the wine list. Surprisingly, they do not limit their selections to those from Napa Valley. There were wines from all over the world. Impressive. As others have mentioned, it is expensive to come here. But when you consider all of the top notch amenities, (including the ability to borrow a brand new Mercedes every day), it really is worth the money. And the experience is so luxurious, it's almost overwhelming at times. And this comes from two people who have very high standards. My hope is that you too, will enjoy this hotel as much as we did. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “TIME OF OUR LIFE”
Reviews.Author: BobMACBeverlyHills
Reviews.Content: We went to Napa Valley for our annual trip to the wine country.. each year we wonder how can it be better than the last trip... Auberge du Soleil just keeps getting better, when most hotels have cut back on the little things Auberge du Soleil continues to add the little touches that make the difference and they do not go un-noticed.. From the staff and every interaction that is so personal to the small candies at dinner or in room amenities that are so thoughtful and abundant. Hats off to everyone!!! The staff at the pool, the valets and the restaurant Your service, food, rooms are spectacular!!!! We will be back next year and cannot wait! Merci!

Reviews.Title: “first class accommodation and service in a perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: happyincanadaOttawa
Reviews.Content: can't say anything more about this hotel/resort. first class all the way. Subtle service, picturesque setting, fabulous food.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Judy015
Reviews.Content: The Auberge is an absolutely beautiful resort. The property is ideally located between St. Helena and Yountville, which is perfect for both wine tasting and eating at the best restaurants. The grounds are lovely with beautiful paths and sculptures and a total feeling of privacy and romance. We stayed in both the lower valley view suite (huge, but outrageously expensive), and the upper valley view maison (a little small, but a beautiful view and a better value). We ate at the restaurant for breakfast and lunch. The food is very good and at the bar area pretty reasonable. The view from the restaurant and bar terraces is amazing. Breakfast is included at the restaurant, my one complaint is that for the prices here it should be available as room service as well. The pool area is also lovely, and the young men that work there epitomize great service. The hotel has Mercedes house cars that are available on a first come basis, which is a true luxury amenity. There is no arguing that the resort is expensive, but it truly is a special occasion destination.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive - But Worth It”
Reviews.Author: GreatBearCaifornia
Reviews.Content: This is clearly the most expensive hotel that I have every stayed at. However, as a treat for a long weekend, it was worth it. We had a suite, and it was spacious, the bed was comfortable, the hotel grounds were very pretty, the restaurant was delicious and the spa was excellent. You have to go expecting to be separated from your money, but if that is going to bother you, then you are definitely in the wrong hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's reputation precedes reality”
Reviews.Author: AKCLondon
Reviews.Content: This was probably the most i have ever paid for a hotel room. While i had a good stay, the room itself was a little disappointing. The interior of the cottages are dark with a yucky yellow/orange walls. The bathroom was large but the drains were really smelly. THe restaurant had a great view but was overtaken by non staying visitors at weekends and the hotel did not reserve the best seats for paying guests. The food in the hotel is good but the busy carpet and the heavy patterned dark table cloth makes the restaurant feel dated. Also though the menu is tweaked it rarely changes,

Reviews.Title: “Auberge v. Meadowood - worth it in off season”
Reviews.Author: BlondeandBlue99
Reviews.Content: For a year and a half the burning question of "Auberge or Meadowood" has plagued me when heading to wine country. In 2008 I handled Meadowood (see separate review). This year - Auberge. Ditto what everyone else says here about Auberge's amazingness. Hands down Auberge had it over The Competition with regard to view from my king "Maison Upper Valley View". Overlooking the valley and above the fog, the stuff postcards are made of. The room was big, but not exceptionally functional. Token big smooshie bed (good but I've slept on better), a dining table and two matching rattan chairs that were just shy of torture to sit in. The decor, while it grew on me after the first day, is bold. I hope you like orange. And tile floor. I was glad I was on the upper floor. The freebie snacks and drinks in the minibar were well thought out. Fizzy drinks, apple juice, coke, beer, bubbly and still water and couple of fun things I'd never seen before. Snacks were healthy - raisins, granola bar, nutty cracker things, and spiffy ramen noodle bowls. I snacked without guilt and appreciated not having to cart in my own. L-O-V-E-D the Nespresso coffee maker and wondered if housekeeping would miss it. The restaurant food I too found a little hit or miss - the pasta was excellent. The burger - a shoulder shrug. Breakfast room service (eggs benedict) lightening fast and very good. The staff I didn't have any negative interaction with as many here note. After getting my Shop On in downtown St. Helena (wine country = a wine bar every other doorway) I was all excited about spending my last twenty bucks in the spa boutique. What a bust. I spent it on a glass of wine instead. An entire wall of jarred mud and mashed herbs. Don't get me wrong, I love mud and herbs. But I left without even buying a t-shirt - a crime! To console myself and sober up, I walked the grounds and sculpture garden. The gardens are *meticulously* maintained, so much so I was lulled into forgiving whoever decided to go orange in the decor. So - which one is worth your hard earned dollar? Meadowood was a better fit for me. I just *felt* better there. It's cozy. It's private. I think it's entertaining to see people dress up in all white and bat pretty colored balls around the back yard. BUT....when it comes to bang for the buck, Auberge wins. The VIEW, free snacks | drinks | Nespresso, sculpture garden, pool and grounds, oak trees not dropping goop all over your Bentley - it was worth the price of admission. All that said, I won't be returning to Auberge unless it's on someone else's dime.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect, romantic place to stay in Napa!!”
Reviews.Author: lyons56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel in Napa. This was our first time in the Napa Valley and we couldn't have stayed in a more perfect location. The staff was very helpful in suggesting and scheduling winery tours and also recommended excellent restaurants for lunch in St. Helena. We loved the three pools at the spa and we got lost in the views there overlooking the valley. We have stayed at luxury inns all over the world and this one is definitely one of our favorites. We are already planning another stay in the fall! Carol, Portland, Oregon

Reviews.Title: “Front desk nowhere near 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline41
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend at the Auberge du Soleil. I was very much looking forward to spending time at this much hyped place. And that's what it is: much hyped, but unfortunately does not live up to the standards. It started with the welcome at the reception: what's with that snotty attitude? Young girls checking us in without any warmth, friendliness or charm. This is the 2nd Auberge we've stayed at (Encantado, Calistoga), and the others are way ahead in terms of service. Turn down service was appalling, and again the reception was just not where it should be (the Yoga teacher on Sunday had trouble reaching the hotel because of a marathon blocking the streets), but nobody told me, so I just went to the closed spa. When I called to ask what happened, I just got a snotty attitude, and when I asked why nobody called me to tell, just a bunch of excuses (none of which made sense), but not apology. Yoga was fabulous in the end, by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Getaway”
Reviews.Author: flywithme03
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Auberge for one night and ended up staying for two. We opted for the more expensive room so we could have a view of the valley. The room was splendid and met all our expectations. The bar area with the food and drinks in the room never went empty. There was always a new bottle of wine in the room for our drinking pleasure. The staff at the pool were very friendly and remembered our name, the view from the pool deck was tremendous. I suggest you try the chocolate chip cookies, they come out warm and are delicious! The two restaurants at the hotel are good but expensive. I preferred my dinner at the casual restaurant (mahi mahi fish sandwich $22) over the dinner (5 course meal $105/person) at the more formal dining restaurant. Breakfast in the morning was incredible, the orange juice, the danishes, the service were all so wonderful and I think it was included in the room charge. The ladies at the front desk were helpful and got us a tee time at Silverado CC. When we are in the san fransisco area, we do plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jamie004
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. The service was wonderful. The staff was friendly and attentive. Our room was great--very comfortable and with great views. The food was absolutely fantastic. We are looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bizley
Reviews.Content: This is probably the loveliest hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms are so comfortable and equipped with everything you could ever think of and also beautiful. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. Loved the spa pools. Loved the food. Only complaint, but quite serious - the music by the pool. We came there to enjoy peace and quiet which was spoiled by the dreadful superflous drum and base background 'musak" at the pool. The pool is in the most beautiful setting with amazing views and we would rather have enjoyed the sounds of nature. Having discussed this with guests at the pool and also the pool staff, I gathered that this music was for the enjoyment of the staff not the guests. For thousands of dollars I would prefer peace.

Reviews.Title: “More interested in your pocket book and how to empty it than anything else.”
Reviews.Author: L2TNH
Reviews.Content: The Auberge is lovely, the food is great, but you can't help but feel that you are getting taken advantage of. Management behaves with an insincere earnestness and concern for guests' well-being is related to the size of the bill being generated. Go and enjoy and try to ignore that instead of your face, the Auberge sees $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but lives up to its hype!”
Reviews.Author: eat-hearty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an upper valley room and the view was breathtaking. I cannot think of a single thing that we needed that was not in the room. A fridge stocked with drinks and snacks (all included in the price). The bed was amazingly comfortable. The gym was great, the pool was beautiful and the service was excellent overall. BUT the restaurant (for dinner) was uneven in quality (one course was inedible, other courses were average) and the service was pretentious and perfunctory. Our courses followed rapidly one after another - we eventually asked them to slow down! Breakfast service was friendly and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest Rooms Leave Much to be Desired”
Reviews.Author: Loungesong
Reviews.Content: Similar to what everyone has already said, this is a very expensive hotel that has done an excellent job anticipating your every need and desire. I went out and purchased a Nespresso machine after we returned home. The attention to detail is felt in the service throughout the property. I found little touches everywhere: some of which I will use at home to make our life a little better! We were in Mainhouse Room 1. We booked this as a view was important to us and other rooms with views were 2-3x as expensive. Unfortunately this was a big mistake. The walls are very thin and we could hear the buzz of normal conversation in the adjoining room as well as the din in the lobby at all hours. This was a real problem in the morning. My wife and I were looking forward to sleeping in until 9 or 10. Unfortunately the clamor of people checking out, loading cars, etc. was unbearable. I find this unacceptable for a room that costs almost a thousand dollars. My other sticking point is the restaurant. The wine program is very impressive, as was all those who served us. Having eaten at most of the restaurants in the area including French Laundry, we were really looking forward to a fine Napa meal within steps of our room. We found most of the dishes over salted, even sending one back. We were not the only people that felt the food was too salty. I had the cheese course for dessert and it was a huge selection of sublime selections. I'm sure we just had an off meal for the restaurant. We will probably return to this hotel, but I do not recommend staying in a Mainhouse Room. PS: My massage with Biz (deep tissue) was the best I've ever had and my wife also said her massage was an absolute dream.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax overnight”
Reviews.Author: inclinekiwi
Reviews.Content: We were only staying one night on our way back to Tahoe. This was a great place to relax and enjoy a really great dinner with a good selection of wines available. Don't be put off by the dress code they mention in their restaurant notes - there were several people in jeans and casual tops. The room was comfortable with lots of little extras. A bit expensive, but worth it for the ambience and view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: SkipNJ
Reviews.Content: Auberge du Soleil is one of the nicest places we've ever stayed, and we've been fortunate enough to stay at some top-notch resorts. The rooms and surrounding area are magnificent. The service is awesome, every staff person we encountered were gracious and professional. You will spend alot to stay at Auberge, but it's worth it. As silly as it is, one of my favorite things was the espresso machine- I may have to buy one! To read more about what I thought of Auberge and other places we visited in Napa, go to www.houseofskip.com Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! STUNNING. WORTH THE PRICE. Prepare yourself for an Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChetX5150
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal. This place ranks at the top of most of my lists for hotel experiences. Amazing setting, great rooms, great service, amazing location. You feel like you are in the south of France or Italy. Upgrade to a room with a view of the valley for sure. We did two days of Limo-driven wine tours in Napa. Also, worth every penny. This hotel is not cheap, but you get what you pay for. Great pools, great spa, great great great restaurant with a deck that overlooks the Napa Valley. Rooms are beautiful, we had a suite with a view and I WILL go back. Napa closes early, and having a great hotel is important--this is the place to stay for a Napa wine weekend. Can't say enough good... and as you can see by my other reviews, I look for things to find fault with. At Auberge, I was amazed and found no faults. (Kinda hard to find, use a good map/GPS.) Can't afford to stay here... eat a lunch here... on deck. I had trouble giving it a 5 for value, but you get every penny worth... Rooms from $700 to $2200 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing. One of few things you must do before you die.”
Reviews.Author: journ3eb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend and two friends, and we were floored at how beautiful the rooms were. We felt like we had a little slice of heaven. We got the suite with a living room, fireplace, large balcony/terrace and amazing mountain view. We woke up on Saturday and opened the French doors in the bedroom to watch the sun come up over the evergreens and listen to the birds. As story-book as it sounds, it is quite simply the number one best experience I have ever had in a hotel, and I travel a lot! The service is exceptional. The food is a 9 out of 10 for room service, and the beds are a dream. It really probably doesn't get better than this. If you want to feel like you TRULY experienced Napa, stay at the Auberge du Soleil. It's quite expensive, but I know I will be back. And don't miss the infinity pool - there are three hot tubs: a "Cool Spring", "Warm Spring" (the infinity pool - the BEST), and the "Hot Spring". We brought champagne flutes and the men brought cigars down to the Warm Spring after hours and we enjoyed a candle lit starry night. Breathtaking. This hotel is over-the-top luxurious and the views are out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Superb from top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: Famcruise
Reviews.Content: One of the nation's greatest resorts. The rooms, service, layout, spa, and restaurant are all outstanding. The rates were even reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Splurge”
Reviews.Author: JRFDallas
Reviews.Content: I have seen some reviews here that are negative, and when you spend a lot on a hotel your expectations are high. The quality of all aspects of our stay was consistant with the price, and was among the best experiences we have had at a top-flight luxury hotel. The setting is pristine, the hillside suites are incredible. The food is worth the star, and about the best we had in Napa. We were sorry for the booming rap music in the room below ours, but when I mentioned it to the staff in short order the sound of the chirping birds returned. A hotel has to meet your budget and aspirations and no hotel is for "everyone", but this one hit our sweet spot.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Paradise”
Reviews.Author: JINA1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are so wonderfully decorated. Nice big soaking tub in the bathroom. Covered lanai thats perfect to enjoy your espresso in the mornings. We have the same espresso maker at home from William Sonoma its a nice touch but there's a lot of them to appreciate at this resort. The service was top notch. Every associate we encountered was so wonderful. The grounds are a nice surprise to explore trails with beautiful artwork. The massage was one of the best I've enjoyed. Champagne while you wait or after your massage to sip while your in the jacuzzi outside overlooking napa wineries. The food was so yummy and again service was top notch. I loved the pool VERY SEXY! A great napa get away with friends. I will be back and continue to recommend. Jinab@comcast.net

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: azreala
Reviews.Content: This place is phenomenal. The service is top notch and the views are breath taking. The spa is unbelievable, and has gorgeous views of the valley. The rooms are very well appointed with a sitting area and balcony. The whole resort has a very relaxing, intimate atmosphere. We felt like we were the only ones there, and we stayed during the busy season!

Reviews.Title: “solitude, sun, and a view”
Reviews.Author: roux2
Reviews.Content: Auberge may be the top place to stay in the Napa Valley, even if the price of the rooms will certainly match the status. Known for the supremicy of its views, it also has the best spa and the best breakfast in the Valley too. The Napa Valley prides itself on its chef-owned restaurants and chic winery experiences. Auberge is situated ten minutes from any of these. After two days of fussy menus and $100 wines, though, you'll be ready for the solitude of its deck where you can take in the sun, sunset, or stars. The cognoscenti know to seek out the bar terrace for a little unpretentious privacy, simple food from oysters to a burger, and generously spaced tables, all of which run nicely counter to the Napa trends. One flaw for brides: even though Auberge charges a lot for the use of its lower terrace and private dining room your wedding will be viewed by the seventy people eating lunch or dinner on the upper terrace. To me, it may be a better choice for an expensive rehersal dinner than the wedding itself.

Reviews.Title: “the best quiet view”
Reviews.Author: sirbSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Perched two-hundred feet or so above the Napa Valley, Auberge is known as one of the top two luxery hotel choices of the Napa Valley. It's one of the few places in the area where you can get away from the bustling noise of the restaurants and the sound of cars and simply nestle into the constant sunshine of this incredible area, look across the Napa Valley for the sunset or the stars, and sip your glass of wine. Auberge has the best spa in the area, the best breakfast, and certainly the most serene atmosphere. The one drawback is for brides: the Auberge weddings occur on their lower terrace while on their upper terrace fifty to ninty people heartily gobble their lunch or dinner and gab with friends. It's an expensive wedding location for the lack of privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mastachef_james
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a stay out at Auberge to celebrate my birthday. And though it was a very lovely place the service was awful!!!!! When we pulled up, then bellmen didn't pay us any attention. The person at the desk who checked us in, could care less about her job or the people who were asking questions. The boy who took us to our room flung open the door shuffled us inside and slammed the door on the way out. I couldn't believe it!!!!! Both my husband and I work in the industry and we were disgusted! We ordered breakfast in room, it was delicious, but again the room service attendant sloppily set out the food on our table. We decided to check out early due to the very poor service, and we had the same awful service at checkout. Because we were so stunned by the poor service all around, I wrote a long email to the General Manager upon our return home. I have yet to have any response from him and it has been three weeks. I cannot believe what great customer service has become, and the fact the GM wouldn't care enough to even respond to a guest complaint. It is ludicrous! We will never stay here again, I can't believe they have been rated so high. It disgusts me!

Reviews.Title: “Auberge du Soleil - beautiful but some flaws for the price”
Reviews.Author: essexnyc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Auberge du Soleil for a long weekend for my 40th birthday. We booked a valley-view suite through AmEx platinum travel service. The hotel and grounds are beautiful, and the hotel is ideally located for exploring wineries in Oakville and northern Napa Valley. The room was excellent, with working fireplace, deep soaking tub, and nice terrace. The pool was also great, as were the hot tubs at the main pool and at the spa. However, given the room rates, we expected the service to be better than it was. Examples: 1) I sent several detailed requests to the concierge to arrange winery tours and tastings and was told that a couple of the wineries that I requested were not available, but in contacting the wineries directly I was able to make appointments; 2) my wife and I asked two different staff the name of an interesting plant and was told by both that they would find out - neither did, and I had to go to the desk to find out; 3) we were running late to dinner one evening and asked the front desk to call the restaurant to advise them - they did not, and we ended up waiting 30 minutes for a table at the restaurant; 4) I left my iPod in the room, and we called the hotel to ask them to mail it back to New York for us - they did but charged the $5 postage to my credit card! All told, these are nitpicks that are not major issues, but these type of details are what makes the difference between my perception that $800 per night for a hotel is worthwhile and my perception that the hotel is somewhat overpriced. Would I stay again? I probably would for another very special occasion, just because it is the best hotel in Napa valley. For my next long weekend in Napa, I'll likely stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but exceptionally good”
Reviews.Author: ghwalker
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the culinary package - expensive and not sure it is the most economic approch. Anyway, apart from the persistent rain our stay was extremely relaxing and very pleasant. Good service started from before we arrived with the extremely helpful concierge taking a great deal of time to organise our trips to two of the best vineyards in the area - Beringer and Frogs Leap. The former in particular was excellent as we were treated to a tasting in the private reserve room and a wine tutorial. Dean was a great teacher, the wine was excellent and undoubtedly result of hotel being 'in the know'. Hotel itself is very cosy - villas are large and very well equipped. Bathrooms are large and very nicely done. Nice terrace that was too wet for us to enjoy but very nice in the sun I would imagine. Views are wonderful - again, spoiled a little by the rain, and the grounds of the hotel are particularly well laid out and nice to wander round. Food was very good - contrary to some reviews I've read. Dinner was excellent, wine good and breakfast was close to best I've had. Seriously expensive place but such a nice experience - in the sun I can't imagine many places nicer to be. Compares very well with other 'luxury' hotels.

Reviews.Title: “impressed”
Reviews.Author: dee090
Reviews.Content: In my opinion the test of a good hotel is not necessarily one where nothing goes wrong - but how one deals with things if something does go wrong. In our case, there was a bit of a mix up over our dinner reservations whilst we were staying there, which really annoyed me. However, once our concerns were made known to the hotel management it was immediately taken care off and for the rest of our stay the staff really went the extra mile to ensure that we were especially well looked after. The service around the pool was first class. We ate in the restaurant both nights and we also found the food and service there to be excellent. I only have 2 niggles that I would mention. firstly, we went to the hotel (as I am sure many others do) as it markets itself as being a tranquil and peaceful (child-free) hotel. the hotel is, however, a very popular wedding venue (understandably). The staff do try to ensure that the weddings don't intrude on the otherwise calm ambience, but this is not an easy balance to achieve. Secondly - although our upper valley room was perfectly ok, it did not scream "luxury". However, we did enjoy our stay there as the service and food throughout were of an excellent standard.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: twoginsonetonic
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from an extremely enjoyable stay at the Auberge du Soleil. The hotel is screamingly expensive, especially for the Upper Valley suite in which we stayed, but at no point did we feel we received poor value for money. The rooms are great, the staff is friendly and the food, both at breakfast and dinner, was also excellent. Niggles are few: the pool area can become a little cramped when busy and could do with more staff, the gym equipment needs to be upgraded and the full payment taken at the time of booking with a 14 day cancellation policy is needlessly mean.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Hefty Price!”
Reviews.Author: faxdoctor
Reviews.Content: Every detail of this resort was incredible. The view from our Valley View suite was amazing. The room itself was gigantic! Our own private patio, seperate sleeping and den, stocked fridge/wine cooler in the kitchen. The food at the restaurant and bar was very very good! The staff was extrememly helpful and treated us like we owned the place. The price was high but they spoile dus in every way possible. The pool, fitness center, steam room.. All grade A! I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Poor Concierge”
Reviews.Author: fansynancy
Reviews.Content: Auberge du Soleil is a heavenly retreat. My husband and I have stayed at Auberge on three different occasions. We adore the privacy, the views, the service and the newly remodeled pool area. It is a real splurge and people should expect a lot for their money. Unfortunately, the level of service through the Concierge desk has deteriorated greatly over the years. As in the past, I left our dinner reservations to the Concierge department. Without fail, every reservation was botched. We arrived at Redd to find our table had been given away. The Concierge desk made our reservation for 6:45 but gave us written confirmation of a 7pm reservation. They double booked us at the French Laundry and Ad Hoc for the same night. They consequently re-booked us, but ended up scheduling us for Ad Hoc brunch and dinner on the same day. I highly recommend Auberge, but have no confidence in their Concierge. Book your own dinner!

Reviews.Title: “See ya!”
Reviews.Author: roadtripCa
Reviews.Content: Time to move on to a different hotel. Auberge has deteriorated to the level of an over-rated has been. The service is selfish, breakfast sent back for being woefully overcooked and "Resting" sign mean nothing to the housekeeping and bell staff. Too bad, it used to be great. It got to the point where I even asked if the hotel had changed ownership....

Reviews.Title: “Happy Anniversary at the Auberge”
Reviews.Author: Rouget
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a blissful weekend here to celebrate our 20th anniversary. We had last been to the Auberge 14 years ago. What can I say but I hope to return here again and again! This place is so romantic! The "rooms" are actually little "casitas" that are named after different wine regions. I love the wood floors and ceilings and the fireplaces. You don't feel you are in a hotel room at all. It's a little rustic and very private feeling. The bathrooms are large and full of wonderful products and candles (one minor complaint - the sink faucets lacked aerators so water tended to spray quite a bit) and there are skylights over the tub.
