A "first aid and intimacy kit" in the medicine cabinet included band-aids and personal lubricant (!). The bed and linens are sooooo comfy. The mini fridge is stocked with champagne, artichoke tapenade, granola bars and lots of other fun stuff and our bellman encouraged us to enjoy them as they are included in the room rate. We had lunch on the restaurant terrace with terrific wines by the glass to kick off our visit - everything was delicious and beautifully presented. The service was great and the views even better. The spa is truly fantastic - the "Auberge massage" is possibly the best massage I have every had. More pressure than Swedish, less intense than deep tissue. The soaking pools were inviting and empty when I was there. The swimming pool and surrounding area are beautiful and the views from the deck are breathtaking. As for service - it couldn't have been better. Solicitous without being fawning and warm without being overly familiar. As for wineries - go to all your favorites but be sure to stop by Darioush on the Silverado Trail to see the amazing Persian architecture and beautiful tasting room. The wines were also excellent. Merryvale Winery, in St. Helena, also had a great tasting room (check out their private dining room!) and delicious wine with very friendly servers. We dined at Redd (blah-overrated), Angele (romantic and delicious country French) and Mustards (delicious upscale diner food to die for-try the pulled pork sandwich!). We drove down to the town of Napa one afternoon and had lunch at Pearl - a wonderful, casual spot which had more locals than tourists in it. Great fish tacos, salads, sandwiches. If you have the time, head south to Domaine Carneros (owned by Taittinger) and enjoy some sparkling wine on the terrace. Yes, the Auberge is expensive but worth a splurge - I'm already saving up for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: andrewchurchill
Reviews.Content: I'd heard so much about Auberge so maybe my expectations were too high. We paid about $700/night. We stayed at one of the 'lower valley view' rooms. The room was beautifully decorated and the bathroom was huge. The refrigerator was stocked with snacks and drinks. BUT the balcony is surrounded by high walls on either side and a pretty high wall/railing so the view was really quite narrow and we didn't spend any time on the balcony as we thought we would. The service was OK, not amazing. I told the porter to tell my husband who was unloading the car where the room was, and he didn't/forgot. The concierge doesn't give very good bike route recommendations - he recommended that we ride down the Silverado Trail and then through downtown St. Helena. We were looking more for picturesque ride and the Silverado Trail is basically a freeway with lots of cars and St. Helen is also full of cars and trucks. He should have told us to drive our car w/ our bikes somewhere picturesque and then start biking from there. The food at the formal restaurant was terrific though and worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Casual elegance in Napa”
Reviews.Author: mmx2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three wonderful nights at the Auberge to celebrate a 50th birthday. This is a quaint and quiet hotel that feels very European in layout and style. As you can see on the hotel website, the hotel is built onto a hillside overlooking the vineyards of Rutherford...and every room has a beautiful and serene view of the country side. We stayed in the lower level maison room and had a lovely terrace to enjoy a glass of wine or a cup of espresso. My only initial dissapointment was in the interior furnishings of the room. The size is fabulous with the seperate living room, butlers kitchen and wonderful bedroom with truly fabulous bedding! But, I tend to appreciate more lush furnishings...and the Auberge is a bit stark for my taste, with a southwestern/contemporary flair. The chairs and coaches are quite stiff and cumbersome...and the rag rugs on the wonderful wood floors a bit tired and dingy looking. Having said this...once you add a roaring fire and light the many candles...the whole effect is quite wonderful! We ate twice at the hotel, once in the formal dining room and once on the bar terrace. Both were fantastic....but we actually enjoyed the bar terrace for the sunsets and the casual Provence feeling. The pool area was lovely and again, had spectacualar views!! And, finally the spa was fantastic and a perfect way to end a romantic and relaxing trip!! I would highly recommend the hotel for couples that are looking to truly relax and enjoy eachother and the lovely Napa valley. And, I would highly recommend visiting in the Spring time!! The field swere all awash in the yellow colors of the mustard plants, the tulips and daffodils were all in bloom and the flowering trees were all in peek color!! verything was lush and green and there were no crowds!! We enjoyed cool evenings but warm (65-70 degree) days and even sat by the pool. The temperature and landscape were breathtaking this time of year (end of Feb beginning of March) Casual Elegance really sums of the Auberge...combined with wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: wanda&ted
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay here. Finally, for my 50th birthday, my husband took me. Luckily, my birthday is in January, when their rates are the lowest and there are not many crowds in the Napa Valley. We have stayed in $500+ hotel rooms before, but Auberge had probably the best service. People were not stuffy, but seemed generally friendly and interested in making your stay just right. Housekeeping was excellent. We didn't see them roaming around with their little carts blocking the walkways, like you see at other hotels. But they seemed to know exactly when to service your room without bothering you. We did not have any problems with the internet service or hot water. The grounds were very well kept. We enjoyed just walking through the sculpture garden. We should have brought a picnic lunch with us. It was just so peaceful. The spa was fantastic. We were able to use the infinity pool with no one else around for a couple of hours. We didn't use the pool, but it was so beautiful and the view was amazing. I wish we had more time to spend out there just relaxing. The facilities had everything you could possible need. Upon arrival, we had a late-night meal in the lounge and the next day, we had dinner in the main dining room. Both were excellent. Can't think of any way to improve it. The hotel was perfect. Service was the best. At every turn, they would anticipate your needs, and it would be there waiting for you. Perfect... perfect... perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ilovemaxy
Reviews.Content: I rate this property right up there with the best I've ever stayed, it was wonderful. The property is imaculent. The bed was so comfortable and the burning fireplace all night made it all the more cozy. We had room 4 in the Versailles building a big patio and quiet. There is a road that seperates the lower rooms from the higher rooms...go for the lower rooms b/c you might have cars driving right outside your balcony if you stay on the higher level. And they all have amazing views! I was impressed with the amenities that were complimentary, an espresso machine with unlimited coffee and a refrig stocked with juice, water and beer...even cheeses and crackers. The bathroom was stocked with nice bath oils and candles and they would replenish them daily! Turndown service lit the entire room with candles each night, started our fireplace and had nice music playing. The restaurant is fantastic too. Be sure and sit in the infinity edge hot tub at the spa - the view is incredible. And if your looking for a great winery, Frogs Leap! Oh and Redd was better than the French Laundry - and $900 less.

Reviews.Title: “Simply beautiful”
Reviews.Author: tuktuktravel
Reviews.Content: We loved the simple elegance of this hotel. I think that the hotel was close to being fully booked, however, it was so peaceful because of the way the rooms are situated. The room was fully stocked with extra amenities that were a treat to discover. The restaurants were excellent, with an incredible view of the Rutherford Valley. The spa was simple, yet serene. The staff was friendly, helpful, and not-the-least-bit snobby. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and serene”
Reviews.Author: hollyhere
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay here. The scenery is gogeous and the rooms are well appointed. I only wish that we could have stayed longer to enjoy the gorgeous pool area. We did eat in the restaurant for dinner as well as breakfast. The food was superb.

Reviews.Title: “So peaceful...”
Reviews.Author: panthere
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed in the lower valley one bedroom suite. The room was very big and it had a great terrace with beautiful views. There were flat screen tvs in each room along with a dvd player. It was a little weird that there was no DVD player remote control, so they brought me one. They said people take them away, so if you need one, ask! There was a huge fridge with a freezer along with some complimentary snacks! The hotel welcomed us with a bottle wine which was very nice! There is a parking lot by the rooms, so you don't have to walk far away to the car and back. The property is well maintained. There are some places you can explore, such as the herb garden and sculptures throughout. The pool is very nice and not too crowded. There is a big gym with a steam room. There are some complimentary gym classes but they are only on saturdays. We went to a spa at Calistoga ranch (auberge sister resort). We took baths there and had the best massages ever! Auberge is definitely better than Calistoga in rooms and in property... We had dinner at Auberge on the terrace (you have to request a table there). The food was great and views are beautiful!!! The only complaint I have is the lack of good cell phone service in the hotel rooms. I had to use in room phone, and it's pretty expensive! There is however a complementary wireless service in your room, so I was able to use my laptop. But, overall, the hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “With love, from the Auberge”
Reviews.Author: ByronDreams
Reviews.Content: Mmmm, the Auberge du Soleil. I get a little excited just saying it. This place just exudes a blissed out yumminess for me. I will confess up front that I am biased. My husband and I were engaged at the Auberge in a sweet and somewhat tipsy blur. We were also married and recently celebrated an anniversary there. It has been the stage for many happy events. The rooms are perfect in decor, comfort and style. You will want to live here. They really nailed all the details with lots of nice textures, a mostly subtle color palette with a bright splash here and there. All rooms have decks with fabulous views of the valley. The candles, fireplace and well thought out lighting are all excellent touches. Nicer still is the fully stocked pantry filled with complimentary snacks, water, sodas, wine and beer. They also have a proper in-room coffee set up. I've always been annoyed by hotels in this category that nickel and dime guests with their mini-bar nonsense. The Auberge really takes things to a new level by simply providing everything you might want. You feel like a guest in someone's thoughtfully stocked guest house instead of like you are in a hotel. The beds are some of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The spa is spectacular. The details are amazing, for example the massage rooms have radiant heated floors for the cold months. There are pools at different temperatures to meet your needs. There is fruit infused water that is so tasty you'll wonder what is in it. The newly renovated pool is absolutely gorgeous. Lots of lovely couches to curl up on and billowy white drapes. Service, although a bit stiff, is quite good. During our wedding weekend in particular, we joked that if we had called and asked for a pony, one would probably have appeared at our door within 10 minutes. They will help you choose wineries to visit, set up tours, arrange transportation and in our case, go find you a pair of scissors in a hurry. Downsides, which in my opinion are balanced by the upside, and can be managed if you know what's up... The place has gotten so much hype lately (mentioned on Entourage, Christina Aguilera stayed here during her wedding weekend) that it seems to be filled with an LA "I'm so hip/famous/cool that I can't speak" element that I don't find particularly enjoyable. The great thing is that you can almost avoid this completely by avoiding the bar and restaurant. Yes, you will probably run into this scene at the pool, but you'd be missing out by avoiding that after all! You're not missing anything by avoiding the bar (bad service, bad vibe). I think you do miss a bit by avoiding the restaurant which is lovely, but you can have the same menu delivered to your room. Very romantic, private and not a big scene. The prices have also gone through the roof. It graduated from really, really expensive to "holy crap" on our last visit ($980 for a lovely but smallish room recently, compared to $700 for a much bigger one a few years ago). The best way to deal with the price is go during the week if you can and try for slightly off season timing.

Reviews.Title: “Flubbed all the Details”
Reviews.Author: RobLau
Reviews.Content: Regrettably, in its class it falls way short of what we expected. What were the problems? In order of our experience: inoperative internet; no hot water in sinks or tub; very lame recommendations from the concierge which did not comport to our express preferences (we wound up resorting to our guide book which was much better); muffed room service orders two out of three meals; inability to soft boil an egg in their restaurant after two tries;inattentive if not surly service at the bar; and an inability to provide a breakfast prior to our 7 am departure for the airport. When a facility proudly holds itself out as world class, there is much room for disappointment, and that is the room we found at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, though wished the pool weren't under construction”
Reviews.Author: Brauna
Reviews.Content: We had eaten at the restaurant, which we loved, but never stayed at the hotel. We decided to do so after a stressful move, and it was the absolute antidote! We enjoyed our room, loved the room service breakfast one morning and the restaurant breakfast another. The spa was great, and we only wished we had allowed for more time at the spa. We were sorry about the pool construction, but that's the way it is. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: RedCharleston
Reviews.Content: Auberge is the most wonderful place we have ever stayed and we have stayed in a bunch of very top notch places. When we arrived, we were greeted and ushered to the reception area --- we had reserved an Upper Valley View King Room --- and were told we had been upgraded to an Upper Valley View King Suite!!! What a treat! When we got to our suite we were just blown away by the beauty of it. Auberge had thought of EVERYTHING -- even having wine, cheese, crackers and fruit on a tray waiting for us in the suite. Not to mention a fully stocked Butler's Pantry -- with a nepresso coffee maker and selection of coffees, tea pot and teas, a subzero refrigerator stocked with waters, juices, soft drinks, dip, crackers, pretzels, chocolate, local beer. A fireplace with firelogs ready to be lit. A bath with wonderful lotion, shampoo and conditioner, gel, and Dr. Hauschka bath oils, haridryer, robes, slippers, umbrellas, lint brush. A wonderful entertainment system with music that could be turned on in every room, including outside area, 3 tvs, and a number a great cds and books. We could not have asked for more! We enjoyed breakfast in our room each morning -- it was pleasantly delivered along with the newspaper very prmoptly at the requested time, along with anything else you had asked be brought as well. The room service was EXCELLENT. We also enjoyed a couple's massage in the Melisse Suite -- we have a lot of massages and this was by far the best either of us had ever had. The locker rooms are also very nice and well appointed. The different pools at the spa are beautiful and the atmosphere/view is total relaxation. The Restauarant at Auberge was also outstanding -- we enjoyed a very romantic, extremely delicious meal with tasting menu paired with wines -- it was too much food to eat all of every course (not skimpy like some tasting menus), but we tried to eat as much of it as we could --- it was worth saving room for dessert which was some of the best we have ever had as well. I can't say enough about Auberge --- It was worth the money and we would go back again and again. Next time we will plan to have even more "down time" to enjoy the resort to the fullest extent. It was wonderful to have such a prefect place to get away and enjoy Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “I sleep better in my car”
Reviews.Author: GoneGaga
Reviews.Content: Over-rated, overpriced. We stayed in the Versaille building last weekend. Seriously flawed -- sure it was pretty and clean and had nice amenities... but the noise was wicked. I heard every footstep and drawer opening and door closing in the rooms around me! The stereo and TV couldn't cover the vibrations. An afternoon nap was out of the question. Even while showering I heard my neighbors' footsteps as if they were in my room. VERY disconcerting. I don't like paying this much for such poor quality. My complaints to the desk got me nothing -- not another room, not a white noise machine, no compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Now THIS is a real 5 star hotel. My favorite in America!”
Reviews.Author: Brainy_Babe
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now (once three months ago and once 8 years ago) and wow, it still is as great as it was the first time. I plan on going back again. Quiet (can't hear any neighbors or noise and so peaceful) Clean (beautifully kept rooms - more of a house actually with ALL the amenities!) and so many free extras like a fridge full of yummy healthy snacks in the full beautiful kitchen. Exquisite views. Friendly staff, Comfy beds. Gorgeous bathrooms. Fireplace to DIE for... I will be back and probably won't ever find another hotel that compares to this one. I admit I'm picky but haven't found ONE fault with this perfect paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: eh555
Reviews.Content: We had a small corporate outing at Auberge in August, and I have been remiss in writing my review. The facilities are wonderful, and I would be thrilled to go back on someone else's dime again:), but I have to say that I found the service to be unacceptable for that price point ($800/nt). The front desk in particular was pretty bad - not quite rude, but far from friendly or helpful. My room wasn't ready when I arrived (after check-in time) and there was no apology. And yet when I asked for a late check out, I was denied - again no apology. I tried calling the front desk before my arrival to check on a couple things, and I was put on hold for 4mins and then they said they couldnt give me any information about my room - they hadn't determined where I would be (this was at 2pm on my arrival day). On none of these occasions were they at all friendly. It just didnt sit right with me - other resorts of this calibre (Casa Palmero at Pebble Beach, Las Ventanas in Cabo) treat guests MUCH better - they would NEVER say they couldn't provide information on a room or not have a room ready without acknowledging a problem and trying to make amends. I doubt I would splurge here - think you can do better for the money. Room was wonderful though - as you would expect - bathtub was to die for... Spa was gorgeous (most beautiful inifinity pools with views of vineyards), though the massage was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: himaintenanc
Reviews.Content: Auberge is the quintessential Napa valley resort and the best place to stay in the area. We really enjoy staying here and will continue to stay there when we visit Napa. We stayed at Auberge for several days in April of 2005 during a wine tasting trip and then again last month in connection with a party we had at Kuleto's winery (which I highly recommend). The rooms are luxurious and the service is generally good - but not overly impressive (i.e. the coffee machines in both of our friends' rooms broke and no one ever showed up to fix or replace them). The large bathtubs in the bathrooms are great and I really enjoy the fireplace (which most rooms have) as it gets cool in the evenings and it makes the room very cozy and romantic. Avoid the main house rooms at all cost - some of our family members stayed there and it is like staying at the Hilton. However, all of the other rooms and suites that we stayed in and saw were lovely. The gym is nice and spa services were good. I didn't care for either meal that we had at the main restaurant and would recommend going to other restaurants in the area ( French Laundry is always a treat but there are a lot of other fab places in the area). Having a wonderful driver who knows the small wineries where you get more for your money and often get to meet the wine makers themselves made all of the difference to our trip. I cannot recommend Larry (Your driver in Napa) highly enough. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A magnificent anniversary experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelLght
Reviews.Content: Truly expensive & truly worth it. We stayed for one night, booking a garden view room but were upgraded to a hillside view room. Service was fantastic - at our beck & call for any needs. The grounds were spacious & we enjoyed following the pathways of the olive grove & seeing the numerous modern sculptures. My wife's spa massage was "to die for," & I enjoyed lounging in a vanishing pool jacuzzi in the meantime. We borrowed the art supplies & I painted a quick oil of our room as a reminder of such a wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Life is too short. "Listen to the voices in your head"”
Reviews.Author: BrianKelly
Reviews.Content: I drove up last weekend on a Sunday for the night from San Franciso where I live to celebrate our wedding anniversary . The service, room, and staff are top notch. We spent a few hours at the spa which is amazing. It felt like we flew to France and drove our car home the next day in only 1.5 hours. Very few places can give you that experience. Special thanks to "Carol" in reservations for making this day so special. "Listen to the voices in your head" JUST DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, First-Class hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: JewelryGirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were scheduled to stay in a private villa at this hotel through a work-related trip. We did not really know what to expect, it was my first time in the Napa Valley. The hotel, villa and service were great. For the price of the room, these things are expected. While we were there, we needed soe medial supplies since a store was not nearby and we did not have a car (we were supplied drivers that were off for the night) and the room service brought us what they had, right away. We ordered room service one morning and after almost an hour and a half, we were told that our server fell down a flight of stairs...we finally got our food but we had to head out for the day. This of course was an out of the ordinary situation, but I would have thought that they would be able to work around this. It was not a big deal, just an odd situation - but the room was amazing - a nice apartment for our long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Total Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: aws70
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous vacation to Napa/Sonoma including a 2 night stay at Auberge du Soleil. Very expensive, but it was totally worth it. I have never felt so relaxed and pampered. Great service, beautiful view (lower valley view maison room). I wish we had spent all of our time there. I'm ready to go back and definitely will!

Reviews.Title: “Skip the restaurant! The attitude of the staff is appalling”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got married quietly in a nearby winery and decided to bring a few friends to this restaurant to celebrate. Most of the staff were snobbish, especially the restaurant receptionist. The valets were impolite. The tasting menu is okay, but not worth the price. The service is slow. And the prices on the wine list were very overpriced, for example, a bottle of red Coppola which is normally $35 is almost $200. I would advise that you bring your own bottles and pay the corkage. The average bottle of wine is $400-600. Finally, the bill took forever to come. This dinner was the black spot on my wedding day. They didn't make it special at all. Skip the restaurant. I really regret booking here. They ruined my evening.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the complete first-class Napa Valley experience stay at the Auberge du Soleil, have dinner at the French Laundry, and tour Shafer Vineyards (taste their Cabernet Sauvignon Hillside Select).

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Napa retreat”
Reviews.Author: shewolfe
Reviews.Content: My husband booked three nights for us to celebrate my 40th birthday. It was the most wonderful and relaxing retreat. The service was wonderful, attentive but not overly so. There was a birthday cake waiting for me upon arrival and a bottle of champagne. We ate breakfast in our suite each morning and enjoyed watching the rain over the Napa valley. The robes, towel, bath oils provided are all luxurious. Room service was great. The rooms are spacious and romantic. We built fires, soaked in our tub and enjoyed the spa. There's even a great little gym that is fully stocked with equipment, headphones, towels, water etc. Truly 5 star all the way. It was a total splurge but oh so worth it. This is the perfect romantic getaway destination.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Napa Retreat!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSoccerMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Napa where we celebrated our 1 yr anniversary at Auberge du Soleil. We booked a package that included 2 nights in one of their Hillside view suites, 2 90 min massages and dinner at their house restaurant. We couldn't have been more pleased with the the service, attention to detail and spectacular accomodations. In our room we were greeted by a welcome note congratulating us on our anniversary along with a bottle of wine and a little dessert treat. It also happened to be Valentine's Day and all rooms were hand delivered a half bottle of champagne, a candle, aromatherapy oil and chocolates. Dinner at the restaurant was amazing -- all we had read was true. The Spa was equally as amazing -- we had our massages in a couples suite. I highly recommend taking a trip to Auberge du Soleil for a special occasion. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: DQ
Reviews.Content: Was originally disappointed that we were unable to book a room at Auberge. As it was a surprise visit for my wife's birthday (we live in Virginia and had never been to Napa), I had booked another hotel and was put on the wait list at Auberge. On our way out of town, I signed on to book dinner reservations for that evening in DC and saw I had a message from the reservations manager. She informed me that a room had come available for the dates that I had requested. Whirlwind ensued cancelling other accomodations...which had a 72 hour cancellation policy. Hey...it was 75 hours out! After a couple days in San Francisco, we arrived at the hotel. The property is just what the Doctor ordered. Friendly, courteous check in. Escorted to suite by following golf cart driven by bellman. Lower Level suite was wonderful. Simple tiled floors, lovely French Doors to patio, large luxurious bathroom with sunken tub and separate shower. Great amenities. The best part was the unbelievable bedding. Room had two flat screens and a CD player witha small library of music. Working fireplace that was great both in the morning and evening. Thought it was hard to beat Ritz Carlton, but guess what, it did!!! We did not eat at the restaurant, but did enjoy the verandah by off the lounge two of the evenings. Stunning views and wonderful selection of appetizers. Casual yet crisp service. Room service as well was first class. Waiter actually retreived toaster from under coffee pantry in room and plugged it in on patio to allow us to toast bagel for Smoked salmon. Little things do make a difference. Concierges were most helpful. Steered us towards great wine venues and made any reservation requests that we had with ease. Upon departure, I had over six cases of wine to be shipped. They arranged everything and it arrived back on the East coast in tact. While the rates are very high, it was worth every penny. My new motto is "no regrets," and I can assure you, we did not have one regret by staying at Auberge du Soleil PS-Thank you to whomever cancelled their reservation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to stay here for years and finally splurged for a birthday. This is the most beautiful, romantic, relaxing place to stay. We also stayed at their sister resort, Calistoga Ranch. Our room was a Cottage Room with a Lower Valley View. The room has a cozy fireplace & a terrace that comes with a sun umbrella, a lounge chair, and a table with two chairs. The decor is very comfortable, yet very elegant. The bathroom has a very large soaking tub complete with candles. The room comes with a bottle of Champagne, fresh fruit, sodas, pretzels, Swiss Milk Chocolate, Granola Bars, & Cheese with Crackers. They even had a small birthday cake waiting. The spa is well worth a vist, very tranquil with a beautiful courtyard. We had lunch at the bar restaurant which has patio seating overlooking the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “The Trip of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: joopynyc
Reviews.Content: Let's get one thing out of the way: Auberge du Soleil isn't cheap. Each time we tell our friends that, however, it's always followed by "but it's worth every penny." Our praises start months before our stay even began. In planning our special vacation, I contacted the hotel's concierge for ideas and help. He was prompt and professional, sending me maps and lists of suggested restaurants and vineyards. He was even able to secure a reservation at a certain culinary temple in Yountville for us! We arrived at Auberge and were greeted warmly by the staff. If your idea of luxury is laced with pomp and ceremony, this is not the place for you. What sets Auberge apart is their way of making you feel thought of, taken care of, at home in every single way. Upon signing in we were told that our room had been upgraded. And what a room it was! Spacious, beautiful, perfect, it came with a private terrace overlooking the valley, a fireplace, 3 flatscreen TVs, and a luxurious bathroom. The personal touches all serve to make you feel at home (your names are handwritten on the mailbox outside your suite, you have a choice of newspapers in the morning, a welcome note with complimentary cheese and wine await you at arrival). The spa is a must (try the couples outdoor mud bath and massage treatment). They even arranged for a tennis partner for me (my partner doesn't play). The hotel also arranged for a knowledgeable driver to take us for a wine-tasting tour. And have drinks at the main house terrace at sunset; nothing will compare to the experience. Admittedly, Auberge was just a part of what made our trip great. The weather, the wine, the food were all necessary ingridients. But so was Auberge du Soleil. And we can't wait to have our second trip of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Pinnacle of holidaying experience”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravellerPG
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on the culinary experience package which included a King room, Dinner for 2, in room wine amenity and 2 glasses of wine during dinner ($925 inclusive). Each room was part of a 4 to 6 unit chalet with own entrance on the side of the hill with car parking just outside the room. Elegant spacious room with stunning valley view. Complementay refrehment bar with included wi-fi connectivity (which my apple laptop picked up without any problem). Wonderful spacious marble bathrooms. Effective Air con and circular suspended ceiling fan from the high ceiling. Excellent Dinner (food an service) Sommellier made choice of our included wine to accompany our starters. Huge and comprehensive wine list with a particular focus on Napa wine, but the overseas selection was extensive too. We also partook in the (complementary) Wednesday evening wine tasting where a local producer offered some of their premium wines for flight tasting (Sommellier was present for this) Overall service was at a very high level. Given infinte wealth, I'd take an extensive vacation here. The package is not cheap but we'll definitely come back. The room was the best I've ever stayed in. Also an unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “value is lacking for price - underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: mauna_kea_lady
Reviews.Content: we found Auberge to be nice but not worth the staggering price. we stayed in an upper valley view suite for 2 nights. the room price was $1350 per night, so we expected to be wowed in all departments. we were a bit underwhelmed with the experience in general; the room decor was nice but not superb, the valley view from the deck was mostly blocked by trees, the service was good but not great, the food was good but not great. the spa WAS great, though. we felt a bit ripped off and like we were fleeced by the trip - we would have felt it's value worth about half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Planning our next visit!”
Reviews.Author: pobh
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge a bit for our 25th anniversary. We spent three unforgettable nights at Auberge. From the moment we arrived we felt special. The upper valley suite was more than we hoped for. The restaurant was superb. The spa, delightful. The redecorated rooms were just right. Sharing champagne on the deck, the sky showered us with falling stars! We can't wait to go back, we are not waiting for our 50th!
